column2: Man is the hardest animal to kill. If he gets away he will come back to kill you.\nSalvatore Maranzano
There's no such thing as good money or bad money. There's just money.\nLucky Luciano
I am an American citizen, first class. I don't have a bade that makes me an official good guy like you, but I work just as honest for a living.\nLucky Luciano
Don't lie. Tell one lie, then you gotta tell another lie to compound on the first.\nMeyer Lansky
Look at the Astors and the Vanderbilts, all those big society people. They were the worst thieves - and now look at them. It's just a matter of time.\nMeyer Lansky
I'm a kind person, I'm kind to everyone, but if you are unkind to me, then kindness is not what you'll remember me for.\nAl Capone
A smile can get you far, but a smile with a gun can get you further.\nAl Capone
I am just a businessman, giving the people what they want.\nAl Capone
Capitalism is the legitimate racket of the ruling class.\nAl Capone

Every time a boy falls of a tricycle, every time a black cat has gray kittens, every time someone stubs a toe, every time there's a murder or a fire or the Marines land in Nicaragua, the police and the newspapers holler 'get Capone'.\nAl Capone
I have spent the best years of my life giving people the lighter pleasures, helping them have a good time, and all I get is abuse, the existence of a hunted man.\nAl Capone
Some call it bootlegging, some call it racketeering. I call it business.\nAl Capone
Be careful who you call your friends. I'd rather have four quarters than one hundred pennies.\nAl Capone
I would rather be rich, affluent and greedy and go to hell when I die, than live in poverty on this earth.\nAl Capone
They can't collect legal taxes from illegal money.\nAl Capone
Judges, lawyers and politicians have a license to steal. We don't need one.\nCarlo Gambino
We're all gonna die, let's act accordingly.\nFrank Costello

Church wants you on your place. Kneel, stand, kneel, stand. If you go for that sort of thing, I don't know what to do for you. A man makes his own way. No one gives it to you. You have to take it.\nFrank Costello
Other kids are brought up nice and sent to Harvard and Yale. Me? I was brought up like a mushroom.\nFrank Costello

When you decide to be something, you can be it. When I was your age, they would say we can become cops or criminals. Today, what I'm saying to you is this: When you're facing a loaded gun, what's the difference?\nFrank Costello
There's no justice in this world.\nFrank Costello
It takes many steppingstones for a man to rise. None can do it unaided.\nJoseph Bonanno
I you think your boss is stupid, remember: You wouldn't have a job if he was any smarter.\nJohn Gotti
Don't carry a gun. It's nice to have them close by, but don't carry them. You might get arrested.\nJohn Gotti
I never lie because I don't fear anyone. You only lie when you're afraid.\nJohn Gotti
Always be nice to bankers. Always be nice to pension fund managers. Always be nice to the media. In that order.\nJohn Gotti
I got nothing against the honest cop on the beat, the kind you can't buy. You just have to have them transferred someplace where they can't do any harm.\nAl Capone
If a man is dumb, someone is going to get the best of him, so why not you? If you don't, you're as dumb as he is.\nArnold Rothstein
There are three sides to every story. Mine, yours and the truth.\nJoe Massino
Behind every great fortune, there is a crime.\nLucky Luciano
Man is the hardest animal to kill. If he gets away he will come back to kill you.\nSalvatore Maranzano
